@RWAB You are the dumb ass. TS doesn't refer to the video quality at all. It means Telesync. Uses a camera to record, but uses an external audio source. Before you start insulting people, you should probably do research. Hopefully you just have it mixed up with R5. R5 refers to a regional code. That of the former Soviet Union. R5 = DVD. It is the same copy you would get from a DVDRIP. Please do your homework before you make yourself look like a fool.

@CapnCajun
That is because your xvid codec creates an error with your Divx codec.
Solution open a non avi folder, set view of that folder to list (files) and then apply to all folders those settings.
Open now your avi folder and it will not crash.
to play... open power dvd or similar (NOT WMP) and select the file from within the players menu and play..... 
So maybe you are a bit wiser now and not so stupid to delete all your files for totally nothing .... well, if you are that stupid, you deserve it. :)
